title: Rapper says McDonald's underpaid him. His new song for Arby's gets revenge
description: Rapper Pusha T says McDonald's stiffed him on his work on its "I'm loving it" jingle. Now, he's switched to Arby's.

title: White House press secretary Jen Psaki tests positive for Covid-19
description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki announced on Tuesday that she has tested positive for Covid-19 for a second time and is experiencing mild symptoms, less than one day before President Joe Biden is scheduled to depart for his trip to Brussels and Warsaw.

title: Cybersecurity CEO: 'More targeted ransonware attacks' by Russia coming
description: Lior Div, CEO of Cybereason analyzes the escalation of cyberattacks against Americans amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Div explains how ransomware attacks may continue as sanctions on Russia become more effective.

title: Putin spokesman refuses to rule out use of nuclear weapons if Russia faced an 'existential threat'
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's chief spokesman has conceded that Russia has yet to achieve any of its military goals in Ukraine and refused to deny that Moscow could resort to the use of nuclear weapons.

title: Disney employees plan to walk out, as ESPN and Disney+ back LGBTQ+ rights
description: Some of Disney's biggest brands are showing support for the LGBTQ+ community as company-wide walkouts by employees in multiple locations are expected to take place on Tuesday.

title: 'What are you so afraid of?': Amanpour to Kremlin spokesman
description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov talks to CNN's Christiane Amanpour about the sentencing of Russian opposition leader and activist Alexey Navalny.

title: Giant debris cloud spotted by NASA telescope after celestial objects collide
description: Space can be a violent place. Objects crash into each other, causing destruction or leading to the formation of larger celestial bodies. Scientists serve as astronomical detectives and use the evidence left behind from these collisions to piece together what happened and learn about the objects involved.

title: Ukrainian sailors block Russian billionaire's yacht in Turkey
description: A group of Ukrainian sailors attempted to block a yacht linked to Russian billionaire, Roman Abramovich as it docked in Turkey.

title: Sandra Bullock still 'embarrassed' she made this movie
description: Sandra Bullock has starred in plenty of hit movies, but there's one project she wishes she passed on.

title: Olympic champion Evgeny Rylov loses Speedo deal after attending Putin rally
description: Swimwear maker Speedo has ended its sponsorship deal with two-time Olympic gold medal swimmer Evgeny Rylov after the Russian attended a rally hosted by Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Tornadoes toss truck, send shoppers fleeing in Texas
description: At least 20 tornadoes have been reported across Texas and Oklahoma. Local officials have reported minor injuries and no fatalities.

title: Wanda Sykes says don't expect 'sober Wanda' at the Oscars
description: Wanda Sykes plans on partying at the Oscars, while she's hosting.

title: Nicaragua sentences ex-presidential candidate to 8 years in prison amid wider opposition crackdown
description: Former Nicaraguan presidential candidate Cristiana Chamorro Barrios was sentenced to eight years in prison for financial crimes on Monday, according to a Nicaraguan human rights non-governmental organization.

title: Judge terminates conservatorship for Amanda Bynes
description: A conservatorship for actress Amanda Bynes, which has been overseeing her personal and professional affairs for the past nine years, was officially ended by a judge on Tuesday.

title: More penalties for passengers from rowdy Cancun party flight
description: New penalties have been issued against some of the passengers who made headlines for their raucous behavior on a chartered flight from Montreal, Canada, to Cancun, Mexico, just before New Year's Eve last year.

title: Tom Hanks is popping up all over Pittsburgh and surprising residents
description: You have to love Tom Hanks.

title: Dolly Parton knows who she wants to play her in a biopic
description: Dolly Parton has long wanted to do a Broadway musical about her life, but the pandemic has her reconsidering that.

title: 'She loved every day of her life.' Family and friends pay tribute to Ukrainian journalist killed in Kyiv
description: The parents of Ukrainian journalist Oleksandra "Sasha" Kuvshynova say the death of their daughter, killed while reporting on the war in their homeland, has helped them to discover a lot more about her life.

title: No survivors found after China's worst air disaster in more than a decade, state media says
description: No survivors of a China Eastern Airlines plane crash have been found as search efforts entered a second day Tuesday, according to Chinese state media.

title: Belarusian military could 'soon' join war in Ukraine, US and NATO officials say
description: The US and NATO believe that Belarus could "soon" join Russia in its war against Ukraine, US and NATO officials tell CNN, and that the country is already taking steps to do so.

title: Could the new BA.2 variant cause another surge? A medical expert explains
description: A subvariant of Omicron, BA.2, is leading to a new wave of Covid-19 infections across Europe. Cases in the United Kingdom, Germany, the Netherlands and other countries are going up, driven by this very contagious coronavirus strain.

title: Rafael Nadal ruled out for up to six weeks with rib stress fracture
description: Rafael Nadal, the 21-time grand slam champion, has suffered a stress fracture in one of his ribs and will be out for four to six weeks, the Spaniard announced on Twitter Tuesday.

title: Maserati reveals its first electric SUV
description: Maserati unveiled its new Grecale SUV Tuesday. It's only the second SUV in the Italian luxury brand's history and the first that will be available in an all-electric version. It's an early step toward making the Italian luxury car brand fully electric by 2030.

title: One of Warhol's Marilyn Monroe portraits could fetch a record $200 million
description: One of Andy Warhol's iconic Marilyn Monroe portraits could become the most expensive 20th-century artwork ever to go under the hammer, with auctioneer Christie's expecting bids "in the region of" $200 million.

title: Oscars preview: 6 things to look for before, during and after the show
description: Despite cosmetic changes and experiments with hosts (or no host), the Oscars have remained largely rooted in tradition, producing a 20th-century TV show for a 21st-century audience. Coming off record-low ratings and with the film industry still reeling from a global pandemic, the burden for the 94th annual Academy Awards will be whether they can pivot to face present realities, and at this point how much good that will do.

title: Russian journalist will auction his Nobel peace medal for Ukrainian refugees
description: The Russian journalist who won last year's Nobel Peace Prize says he will auction off his medal to support Ukrainian refugees.

title: Kylie Jenner announces her son's name is no longer Wolf Webster
description: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott have changed their newborn son's name,

title: There's a key difference in Covid antibody levels in vaccinated versus infected people
description: In 2010, doctors told Ben Sobieck, now 37, that his kidneys were inexplicably failing. Shortly after, he had a kidney transplant and started on the lifelong medications that weaken his immune system to keep his body from rejecting the donor organ. They never figured out what caused Sobieck's kidney failure. But a decade later, he confronted another threat to his health: the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: In Aleppo, we quickly learned hospitals are the most dangerous place
description: I will never forget the first time I saw Russian warcraft in the skies above Aleppo. It was September 2015, I was in my garden with my wife Waad and a friend when we saw three Russian aircraft flying over together, launching a missile attack. I knew at that moment that everything was about to change.

title: Phil Mickelson to miss Masters for first time in 28 years
description: Phil Mickelson is set to miss the Masters for the first time in 28 years after being removed from the tournament's list of active golfers.

title: Ancient sacred pool discovery aligns with the stars
description: An artificial lake off the west coast of Sicily was once one of the largest sacred pools in the ancient Mediterranean 2,500 years ago -- and it was aligned with the stars, according to new research.

title: New images show buildings ablaze and flooding from a river that's critical to the Russian advance toward Kyiv
Putin's next escalation could be a direct cyberattack on the US
description: The most troubling takeaway from President Joe Biden's warning that there is "evolving intelligence" that Russia is exploring options for cyberattacks is that US spy agencies have been spot on so far in predicting Vladimir Putin's moves.

title: Authentication services firm Okta says it is investigating report of breach
description: Authentication services company Okta Inc said on Tuesday it is investigating a report of a digital breach after hackers posted screenshots of what they claimed were its internal company environment.

title: A Mariupol family fled the horror of Russian attacks. But they had to leave their parents behind
description: Dmytro and Tania Shvets spent the first 23 days of the war hiding in their cellar in Mariupol with their 7-year-old daughter, Vlada, and their parents. The family managed to escape the besieged Ukrainian city on Thursday, but their parents stayed behind.

title: Putin's PR game is falling flat
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is trying to prove there's truth in the old expression, 'the pen is mightier than the sword.' Or in his case -- the selfie video is mightier than the Russian fighter jet.

title: Japan opposes Russian withdrawal from World War II peace treaty talks over sanctions
description: Japan reacted angrily on Tuesday after Russia withdrew from peace treaty talks with Japan and froze joint economic projects related to the disputed Kuril Islands because of sanctions imposed by Tokyo over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Russian strike kills 96-year-old Holocaust survivor in Ukraine
description: A 96-year-old Holocaust survivor, Borys Romanchenko, was killed Friday by a Russian strike on the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv.

title: No injuries after severe storm causes 'catastrophic damage' to two schools in Texas
description: Jacksboro Independent School District Superintendent Brad Burnett told CNN affiliate WFAA on Monday that a severe storm that slammed the Texas city caused significant damage to two schools.

title: Takeaways from Ketanji Brown Jackson's first day of Supreme Court confirmation hearings
description: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation hearings kicked off Monday with more than four hours of speeches from senators, introductions of Jackson by two of her colleagues and remarks from the nominee herself.

title: China's zero-Covid policy is showing signs of strain. But ditching it now could be a disaster
description: For nearly two years, China's daily Covid caseload rarely extended into triple digits, and often weeks went by without a single case.

title: 'Impossible to intercept': This is Russia's new deadly weapon
description: US officials confirm that Russia is the first country to use hypersonic missiles ever in combat. CNN's Brian Todd tells us what this means for Ukraine.

title: Actress's dad spoke at Putin's rally. Hear why she is speaking out
description: Russian actress Masha Mashkova is speaking out against Russia's war in Ukraine after her father, Russian actor Vladimir Mashkov, spoke at Vladimir Putin's rally in support of the war.
